poem:
Title: "Upon the Toy's Aging Grace"

Barbie at sixty-five,
resilient in plastic.
Greta's portrayal stirs debates,
beyond screen glitz and static.

In her pink, an icon,
a geopolitical border,
From showbiz glimmer to feminism,
pressing the world's order. 

Over years and borders,
her influence persisted.
In her sixty-five,
how the world has shifted.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "An icon turns 65: Barbie’s changing style showcased in London exhibition You don’t have to be a devotee of popular culture to have noticed the omnipresence of brand Barbie over the past year. The release of Greta Gerwig’s cinematic portrayal of the world’s most famous doll has seen Barbie inserted into debates far beyond the realms of showbiz, from geopolitical border disputes to debates on the state of feminism. But one place where Barbie’s influence". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
